tit.e: Kogosho Conference (the meeting held in the presence of the Emperor in the Kogosho Conference Room of Kyoto Imperial Palace at the night of January 3, 1868, when the Decree for the Restoration of Imperial Rule was issued)
tit.cmt: 登録されている説明だと日付が旧暦になっていますので、西暦に変えました。
tit.e: Kogosho Conference (the meeting held in the presence of the Emperor in the Kogosho Conference Room of Kyoto Imperial Palace at the night of January 3, 1868, when the Decree for the Restoration of Imperial Rule was issued)

Kogosho Conference (the meeting held in the presence of the Emperor in the Kogosho Conference Room of Kyoto Imperial Palace at the night of January 3, 1868, when the Decree for the Restoration of Imperial Rule was issued)

sen.j: 小御所会議（こごしょかいぎ）は、江戸時代末期（幕末）の慶応3年12月9日 (旧暦)（1868年1月3日）に京都の京都御所で行われた国政会議。
sen.e: Kogosho Conference is a meeting on national politics held at Kyoto Palace in Kyoto on January 3, 1868 in later Edo Period.
Kogosho Conference is a meeting on national politics held at Kyoto Palace in Kyoto on January 3, 1868 in the end of Edo Period.
sen.cmt: later→the end of＊laterでも問題ありませんが、「末」の意味をより明確化するためこのように変更しました
sen.e: Kogosho Conference is a meeting on national politics held at Kyoto Palace in Kyoto on January 3, 1868 in the end of Edo Period.

sen.j: 同日に発せられた王政復古の大号令で、新たに設置された三職（総裁・議定・参与）からなる最初の会議である。
sen.e: It was the first meeting to be held by the three top officials (president, legislature, councilor) whose posts were newly-established by the Restoration of Imperial Rule announced on that day.
sen.cmt: 文が不自然ですので、ウィキペディアを見たところ、「近代日本の官制明治時代初期」の部分は「三職」でした。また三職は定訳不明ですが、three top postsとしました。議定の訳は登録のgijoでは分かりにくいので以下を参考にlegislatureにしました。http://books.google.com/books?id=X9Wi2SI30uQC&pg=PA50&lpg=PA50&dq=%22reppan+conference%22&source=bl&ots=TDPYUUhUzU&sig=b45OHpKQrt7imeBEVKYrkbPaQaI&hl=ja&ei=w0pZTPSsMZCjcdGa9MwI&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=3&ved=0CCIQ6AEwAg#v=onepage&q&f=false
sen.e: It was the first meeting to be held by the three offices (president, legislature, councilor) whose posts were newly-established by the Restoration of Imperial Rule announced on that day.
sen.cmt: ・原文はリンク先表示だったため修正しました。・「三職」は調査のうえ用語共有に登録しました→three offices
sen.e: It was the first meeting to be held by the three offices (president, legislature, councilor) whose posts were newly-established by the Restoration of Imperial Rule announced on that day.

sen.j: すでに大政奉還していた徳川慶喜の官職（内大臣）辞職および徳川家領の削封が決定され、倒幕運動の計画に沿った決議となったため、王政復古の大号令と合わせて「王政復古クーデター」と呼ばれることもある。
sen.e: Together with the Decree (of 1867) for the Restoration of Imperial Rule, it is also called 'Coup of the Restoration of Imperial Rule' because the meeting accepted the resignation of Yoshinobu TOKUGAWA as a government official (Minister of the Center) as well as reduced-stipend of Tokugawa Family and also its resolution was made in accordance with the plot to overthrow the Tokugawa Shogunate.

Together with the Decree for the Restoration of Imperial Rule, it is also called 'Coup of the Restoration of Imperial Rule' because the meeting accepted the resignation of Yoshinobu TOKUGAWA, whose power had already been transferred back to the Emperor, as a government official (Minister of the Center) as well as reduced-stipend of Tokugawa Family, thus the resolution of the conference was made in accordance with the plot to overthrow the Tokugawa Shogunate.
sen.cmt: ・（of 1867）は削除しました・「すでに大政奉還していた」を訳出しました・and also its resolution was made→thus the resolution of the conference was made※主語を明確化しました
sen.e: Together with the Decree for the Restoration of Imperial Rule, it is also called 'Coup of the Restoration of Imperial Rule' because the meeting accepted the resignation of Yoshinobu TOKUGAWA, whose power had already been transferred back to the Emperor, as a government official (Minister of the Center) as well as reduced-stipend of Tokugawa Family, thus the resolution of the conference was made in accordance with the plot to overthrow the Tokugawa Shogunate.

sen.j: その一方で、この時期までにしばしば浮上しては頓挫した、雄藩連合による公議政体論路線の一つの到達点という面も持ち合わせていた。
sen.e: Meanwhile, it had an aspect as a goal of controversy over the parliamentary regime promoted by major domains, which had repeatedly emerged and broken down by then.
Meanwhile, it also had an aspect as a goal of controversy over the parliamentary regime promoted by major domains, which had repeatedly emerged and broken down by then.
Meanwhile, it also had an aspect as a goal of controversy over the parliamentary regime promoted by major domains, which had repeatedly emerged and broken down by then.

sen.j: この項では小御所会議前後の状況も合わせて記述する。
sen.e: This section also provides the situation before and after the Kogosho Conference.
This section also provides the situation before and after the Kogosho Conference.
This section also provides the situation before and after the Kogosho Conference.

tit.e: Background
Background
Background
Political situation after the Taisei Hokan (transfer of power back to the Emperor)
Political situation after the Taisei Hokan (transfer of power back to the Emperor)
Political situation after the Taisei Hokan (transfer of power back to the Emperor)

sen.j: 薩摩藩の大久保利通・小松清廉・西郷隆盛らは、5月の四侯会議の失敗から、従来の公議体制路線を改め、武力倒幕路線に転換する。
sen.e: Learning from the failure of Shiko-kaigi (four major lords' meeting) in May, Toshimichi OKUBO, Kiyokado KOMATSU and Takamori SAIGO from Satsuma Domain gave up the traditional parliamentary regime policy and shifted to a route of overthrowing the Shogunate by military power.

Learning from the failure of Shiko-kaigi (four major lords' meeting) in May, Toshimichi OKUBO, Kiyokado KOMATSU and Takamori SAIGO from Satsuma Domain gave up the traditional parliamentary regime policy and shifted their policy to overthrowing the Shogunate by military power.
sen.cmt: ・shifted to a route of→shifted their policy to
sen.e: Learning from the failure of Shiko-kaigi (four major lords' meeting) in May, Toshimichi OKUBO, Kiyokado KOMATSU and Takamori SAIGO from Satsuma Domain gave up the traditional parliamentary regime policy and shifted their policy to overthrowing the Shogunate by military power.

sen.j: 大久保利通らは謹慎中の公家岩倉具視と連携し、討幕の密勅を得るべく朝廷に工作を始めていた。
sen.e: Toshimichi OKUBO, in cooperation with Tomomi IWAKURA, a court noble who was under house arrest, was beginning to pave the way for an anti-shogunate secret Imperial command by working on the Imperial court.

Toshimichi OKUBO and others, in cooperation with Tomomi IWAKURA, a court noble who was under house arrest, was beginning to work on the Imperial court to obtain secret Imperial command for overthrowing the Shogunate.
sen.cmt: ・「ら」を訳出しました・後半を改変しました（「倒幕」は用語共有の語を採用）
sen.e: Toshimichi OKUBO and others, in cooperation with Tomomi IWAKURA, a court noble who was under house arrest, was beginning to work on the Imperial court to obtain secret Imperial command for overthrowing the Shogunate.

sen.j: 軍事的緊張が高まるなか、土佐藩では坂本龍馬の助言（船中八策）を受けた後藤象二郎が、武力激突を回避する大政奉還論を前藩主山内容堂に提案。
sen.e: Amid the intensifying military tension, Shojiro GOTO in Tosa Domain, who received advice from Ryoma SAKAMOTO (Senchu hassaku [the basic outline of the new regime drawn up by Ryoma Sakamoto]), proposed Taisei Hokan theory which would avoid armed clash to Yodo YAMAUCHI, the former lord of domain.

Amid the intensifying military tension, Shojiro GOTO in Tosa Domain, who received advice from Ryoma SAKAMOTO (Senchu hassaku [the basic outline of the new regime drawn up by Ryoma Sakamoto]), proposed Taisei Hokan theory which would avoid armed clash to Yodo YAMAUCHI, the former lord of domain.

Amid the intensifying military tension, Shojiro GOTO in Tosa Domain, who received advice from Ryoma SAKAMOTO (Senchu hassaku [the basic outline of the new regime drawn up by Ryoma Sakamoto]), proposed Taisei Hokan theory which would avoid armed clash to Yodo YAMAUCHI, the former lord of domain.

sen.j: 自らの政治的影響力を保持したいと考えた将軍徳川慶喜はこれを受け入れ、10月13日在京の諸藩士を二条城に招集し、大政奉還を諮問した（翌日、朝廷へ奏上）。
sen.e: Yoshinobu TOKUGAWA, shogun, who wished to continue to hold his political clout, accepted this theory and convened feudal retainers of local domains living in Kyoto to Nijo Castle on October 13 to consult Taisei Hokan (which was reported to the Emperor next day).

Yoshinobu TOKUGAWA, a shogun who wished to continue to hold his political clout, accepted this theory and convened feudal retainers of local domains living in Kyoto to Nijo-jo Castle on October 13 to consult Taisei Hokan (which was reported to the Emperor next day).
sen.cmt: ・Yoshinobu TOKUGAWA, shogun, who wished to continue→Yoshinobu TOKUGAWA, a shogun who wished to continue・Nijo Castle→Nijo-jo Castle
sen.e: Yoshinobu TOKUGAWA, a shogun who wished to continue to hold his political clout, accepted this theory and convened feudal retainers of local domains living in Kyoto to Nijo-jo Castle on October 13 to consult Taisei Hokan (which was reported to the Emperor next day).

sen.j: 同じ13日、薩摩藩へ（翌日には長州藩へ）討幕の密勅が下される寸前に、倒幕派の機先を制した恰好となった。
sen.e: The Taisei Hokan took place when the secret Imperial command to attack the shogunate was just about to be given to Satsuma Domain on the same day (it was supposed to reach Choshu Domain the next day), forestalling tobakuha (anti-Bakufu, crushing-the-Bakufu faction).

The Taisei Hokan took place when the secret Imperial command to attack the shogunate was just about to be given to Satsuma Domain on the same day (it was supposed to reach Choshu Domain the next day), forestalling tobakuha (anti-Bakufu, crushing-the-Bakufu faction).

The Taisei Hokan took place when the secret Imperial command to attack the shogunate was just about to be given to Satsuma Domain on the same day (it was supposed to reach Choshu Domain the next day), forestalling tobakuha (anti-Bakufu, crushing-the-Bakufu faction).

sen.j: 慶喜としては、まだ年若い明治天皇（当時数え年16歳）を戴く朝廷に政権担当能力はなく、やがて組織されるであろう諸侯会議で自らが議長もしくは有力議員となるなどの手段で、政治的影響力を行使できるはずという目論見の上での政権返上であった。
sen.e: Nobuyoshi had an ulterior motive that, even after he returned the administration to the Imperial court, he should be able to exercise his political clout as the chairman or as a powerful councilor of the loads conference which was to be organized later, because the Emperor Meiji was too young (in his 16th year) to have the ability to hold the reins of government, so was the Imperial court.

Nobuyoshi had an ulterior motive that, even after he returned the administration to the Imperial court, he should be able to exercise his political clout as the chairman or as a powerful councilor of the lords conference which was to be organized later, because the Emperor Meiji was too young (in his 16th year) to have the ability to hold the reins of government, so was the Imperial court.

Nobuyoshi had an ulterior motive that, even after he returned the administration to the Imperial court, he should be able to exercise his political clout as the chairman or as a powerful councilor of the lords conference which was to be organized later, because the Emperor Meiji was too young (in his 16th year) to have the ability to hold the reins of government, so was the Imperial court.

sen.j: 果たして倒幕派の勢力はまだ弱く、10月21日朝廷は討幕の密勅の中止を指示、23日には外交権がまだ幕府にあることを認める通知を出す。
sen.e: Certainly, the power of tobakuha was still weak, so the Imperial court commanded to cancel the secret Imperial command to attack the shogunate on October 21 and sent note to recognize that the diplomatic right still belonged to the shogunate on 23.

Certainly, the power of tobakuha was still weak, so the Imperial court commanded to cancel the secret Imperial command to attack the shogunate on October 21 and issued the notification to recognize that the diplomatic right still belonged to the shogunate on 23.

Certainly, the power of tobakuha was still weak, so the Imperial court commanded to cancel the secret Imperial command to attack the shogunate on October 21 and issued the notification to recognize that the diplomatic right still belonged to the shogunate on 23.

sen.j: こうした状況下、10月24日徳川慶喜は将軍職の辞表を提出するが、これは当然不受理となることを見越した上でのものであり、実際朝廷から保留されている。
sen.e: Against such backdrop, Yoshinobu TOKUGAWA submitted his letter of resignation as shogunate on October 24, obviously anticipating to be refused and was, in fact, put on hold by the Imperial court.
Against such backdrop, Yoshinobu TOKUGAWA submitted his letter of resignation as shogunate on October 24, obviously anticipating to be refused and was, in fact, put on hold by the Imperial court.
Against such backdrop, Yoshinobu TOKUGAWA submitted his letter of resignation as shogunate on October 24, obviously anticipating to be refused and was, in fact, put on hold by the Imperial court.

sen.j: 倒幕派は朝命で諸藩へ上京を命じるが、政局の激変を様子見している藩が多く、応じる藩は少なかった。
sen.e: Tobakuha issued the order of Imperial court to domains to come up to the capital, Kyoto, but few responded as most of them remained watching the drastically changing political situation.
Tobakuha issued the order of Imperial court to domains to come up to the capital, Kyoto, but few responded as most of them remained watching the drastically changing political situation.
Tobakuha issued the order of Imperial court to domains to come up to the capital, Kyoto, but few responded as most of them remained watching the drastically changing political situation.

sen.j: 11月13日島津忠義（薩摩藩主）率いる薩摩軍3000人が上京するが、他藩の動きは鈍かった（なお同じく倒幕派の長州藩は禁門の変以来朝敵となっており、入京を許可されていなかった）。
sen.e: While 3,000 Satsuma troops led by Tadayoshi SHIMAZU (lord of Satsuma domain) went up to Kyoto, other domains were slow to follow (Choshu Domain of the same tobakuha group was not allowed to enter Kyoto since it had been regarded as the Emperor's enemy after the Kinmon Incident).

While 3,000 Satsuma troops led by Tadayoshi SHIMAZU (lord of Satsuma domain) went up to Kyoto in December 8, other domains were slow to follow (Choshu Domain of the same tobakuha group was not allowed to enter Kyoto since it had been regarded as the Emperor's enemy after the Kinmon Incident).
sen.cmt: 11月13日を訳出しました（慶応3年11月13日は1867.12.8）
sen.e: While 3,000 Satsuma troops led by Tadayoshi SHIMAZU (lord of Satsuma domain) went up to Kyoto in December 8, other domains were slow to follow (Choshu Domain of the same tobakuha group was not allowed to enter Kyoto since it had been regarded as the Emperor's enemy after the Kinmon Incident).

tit.e: Decree (of 1867) for the Restoration of Imperial Rule
Decree for the Restoration of Imperial Rule
Decree for the Restoration of Imperial Rule

sen.j: 詳細は王政復古を参照。
sen.e: Refer to Restoration of Imperial Rule for details.
Refer to Restoration of Imperial Rule for details.
Refer to Restoration of Imperial Rule for details.

sen.j: 上記のような閉塞状況を打破するため、大久保利通や岩倉具視は秘かにクーデター計画を練る。
sen.e: To break the above-mentioned deadlock, Toshimichi OKUBO and Tomomi IWAKURA secretly plotted a coup.
To break the above-mentioned deadlock, Toshimichi OKUBO and Tomomi IWAKURA secretly plotted a coup.
To break the above-mentioned deadlock, Toshimichi OKUBO and Tomomi IWAKURA secretly plotted a coup.

sen.j: 12月8日夕方から深更にかけて行われた朝議で、毛利敬親（長州藩主）・毛利元徳（同世子）の官位復活と入京許可、三条実美ら八月十八日の政変で追放された5人の公卿の赦免、および岩倉具視ら謹慎中の公卿の処分解除が決定された。
sen.e: During the Court Council held from the evening of December 8 till late in the night, Takachika MORI (lord of the Choshu clan) and Motonori MORI (Takachika's heir) were allowed to restore their official rank and to enter Kyoto, and the five court nobles, including Sanetomi SANJO who had been expelled since the Coup of August 18, obtained absolution, and also court nobles, including Tomomi IWAKURA who had been under house arrest, were freed from punishment.

In the Court Council held from the evening of till late in the night of January 2, 1868, it was decided that Takachika MORI (lord of the Choshu clan) and Motonori MORI (Takachika's heir) were allowed to restore their official rank and to enter Kyoto, and the five court nobles, including Sanetomi SANJO who had been expelled since the Coup of August 18, obtained absolution, and also court nobles, including Tomomi IWAKURA who had been under house arrest, were freed from punishment.
sen.cmt: ・この時点では決議のみがなされ処分は実行されていないので、during→inと変更し、it was decided thatを補完しました・慶応3年12月8日→1868.1.2をもとに変更しました
sen.e: In the Court Council held from the evening of till late in the night of January 2, 1868, it was decided that Takachika MORI (lord of the Choshu clan) and Motonori MORI (Takachika's heir) were allowed to restore their official rank and to enter Kyoto, and the five court nobles, including Sanetomi SANJO who had been expelled since the Coup of August 18, obtained absolution, and also court nobles, including Tomomi IWAKURA who had been under house arrest, were freed from punishment.

sen.j: 翌9日未明、公卿たちが退廷した後、待機していた薩摩藩・芸州藩・尾張藩など5藩の軍が御所9門を固め、摂政二条斉敬をはじめ要人の御所への立ち入りを禁止した後、明治天皇臨御の下、御所内学問所において王政復古の大号令が発せられた。
sen.e: Before the dawn of the next day, the court nobles left the court and the armies of five domains, such as Satsuma Domain, Geishu Domain and Owari Domain, who had been on standby, guarded the nine gates of the Imperial Palace to prohibit Nariyuki NIJO and other government officials from entering the Imperial Palace, the Decree (of 1867) for the Restoration of Imperial Rule was announced at the Emperor's study room inside the Imperial Palace under the presence of the Emperor Meiji.

Before the dawn of the next day, the court nobles left the court and the armies of five domains, such as Satsuma Domain, Geishu Domain and Owari Domain, who had been on standby, guarded the nine gates of the Imperial Palace to prohibit Nariyuki NIJO and other government officials from entering the Imperial Palace, then the Decree for the Restoration of Imperial Rule was announced at the Emperor's study room inside the Imperial Palace under the presence of the Emperor Meiji.
sen.cmt: the Decree （of 1867） for the Restoration of Imperial Rule was announcedの直前にthenを補完し、（of 1867）を削除しました
sen.e: Before the dawn of the next day, the court nobles left the court and the armies of five domains, such as Satsuma Domain, Geishu Domain and Owari Domain, who had been on standby, guarded the nine gates of the Imperial Palace to prohibit Nariyuki NIJO and other government officials from entering the Imperial Palace, then the Decree for the Restoration of Imperial Rule was announced at the Emperor's study room inside the Imperial Palace under the presence of the Emperor Meiji.

sen.j: 新政権の樹立と天皇親政をうたい、摂政・関白・征夷大将軍職の廃止、新たに総裁、議定、参与の三職を置くなどの方針が発表された。
sen.e: It declared the launch of a new administration and the direct rule by the Emperor, and accounted the abolition of Sessho (regent), Kampaku (chief adviser to the Emperor) and Seitaishogun (commander-in-chief of the expeditionary force against the barbarians, great, unifying leader) and instead, the creation of three top posts; president, legislature, and councilor.

It declared the launch of a new administration and the direct rule by the Emperor, and accounted the abolition of Sessho (regent), Kanpaku (chief adviser to the Emperor) and Seitaishogun (commander-in-chief of the expeditionary force against the barbarians, great, unifying leader) and instead, the creation of three offices; president, legislature, and councilor.

It declared the launch of a new administration and the direct rule by the Emperor, and accounted the abolition of Sessho (regent), Kanpaku (chief adviser to the Emperor) and Seitaishogun (commander-in-chief of the expeditionary force against the barbarians, great, unifying leader) and instead, the creation of three offices; president, legislature, and councilor.

sen.j: これにより、二条摂政や久邇宮朝彦親王ら親幕府的な公卿は発言権を失うことになった。
sen.e: This led to the deprivation of voices from Sessho Nijo, Imperial Prince Kuninomiya Asahiko and other pro-tobakuha court nobles.
This led to the deprivation of voices from Sessho Nijo, Imperial Prince Kuninomiya Asahiko and other pro-bakufu court nobles.
This led to the deprivation of voices from Sessho Nijo, Imperial Prince Kuninomiya Asahiko and other pro-bakufu court nobles.

sen.j: この大号令を受けて、さっそく新設の三職を小御所へ召集し、同日18時頃から小御所会議が開かれた。
sen.e: Following the Decree, newly-appointed three top posts were called to Kogosho Palace to hold Kogosho Conference from 18:00 on that day.
Following the Decree, newly-appointed three offices were called to Kogosho Palace to hold Kogosho Conference from around 18:00 on that day.
Following the Decree, newly-appointed three offices were called to Kogosho Palace to hold Kogosho Conference from around 18:00 on that day.

sen.j: ただし各藩の藩士はほとんどが後日（12月10日～12日）の追任であり、小御所会議に出席していない尾張の尾崎良知、越前の毛受鹿之助、芸州の久保田平司、土佐の福岡孝悌も参与に追任されている。
sen.e: But the appointment of most feudal retainers of domains came in the succeeding days (December 10-12), for example, Yoshitomo OZAKI of Owari, 鹿之助 MENJU of Echizen, Heiji KOBOTA of Geishu, and Takachika FUKUOKA of Tosa who were not present at Kogosho Conference, were later appointed to councilor.

sen.e: But the appointment of most feudal retainers of domains came in the succeeding days (January 4-6, 1868), for example, Yoshitomo OZAKI of Owari, Shikanosuke MENJU of Echizen, Heiji KUBOTA of Geishu, and Takachika FUKUOKA of Tosa who were not present at Kogosho Conference, were later appointed to councilor.
sen.cmt: ・西暦へ変換しました・「毛受鹿之助」の読み：苗字はOKですが名前が確認できませんでした・KOBOTA→KUBOTA
sen.e: But the appointment of most of the feudal retainers for the domains came later (January 4-6, 1868); for example, Yoshitomo OZAKI from Owari, Shikanosuke MENJU from Echizen, Heiji KUBOTA from Geishu, and Takachika FUKUOKA from Tosa, who were not present at the Kogosho Conference, were later appointed councilors.

sen.j: 大久保や西郷としては、王政復古の大号令の際に、慶喜の辞官（内大臣の辞職）・納地（徳川家領の返上）の勅命を出させ、徳川家を無力化させることを企図していたが、議定山内容堂・松平春嶽らの抵抗により、審議は小御所会議にずれ込んだ。
sen.e: Okubo and Saigo plotted the disempowerment of the Tokugawa Family at the occasion of the Decree (of 1867) for the Restoration of Imperial Rule by demanding Yoshinobu to resign the government post (resign as the Minister of the Center) and return the Tokugawa land to the Emperor by issuing an Imperial order, but faced protest from Yodo YAMAUCHI and Shungaku MATSUDAIRA, both legislature, so the consideration was suspended until Kogosho Conference.

Okubo and Saigo plotted the disempowerment of the Tokugawa Family at the occasion of the Decree for the Restoration of Imperial Rule by demanding Yoshinobu to jikan (resign the government post as the Minister of the Center) and nochi (return the Tokugawa land to the Emperor) by issuance of an Imperial order, but faced protest from Yodo YAMAUCHI and Shungaku MATSUDAIRA, both legislature, so the consideration was suspended until Kogosho Conference.
sen.cmt: ・ (of 1867)を削除しました・Jikan nochiが83列に出てくるので、左記のように変更しました・issuing→issuance of※大久保や西郷が勅命を出すと誤解される可能性があるので
sen.e: Okubo and Saigo plotted the disempowerment of the Tokugawa Family at the occasion of the Decree for the Restoration of Imperial Rule by demanding Yoshinobu to jikan (resign the government post as the Minister of the Center) and nochi (return the Tokugawa land to the Emperor) by issuance of an Imperial order, but faced protest from Yodo YAMAUCHI and Shungaku MATSUDAIRA, both legislature, so the consideration was suspended until Kogosho Conference.

tit.e: Development of Kogosho Conference
Development of Kogosho Conference
Development of Kogosho Conference

sen.j: 明治天皇の外祖父である議定中山忠能から開会が宣言された後、公家側から「徳川慶喜は政権を返上したというが、果たして忠誠の心から出たものかどうかは怪しい。忠誠を実績を持って示す（辞官納地を指す）よう譴責すべきである」との議題が出される。
sen.e: After the meeting was called to order by Tadayasu NAKAYAMA, Emperor Meiji's maternal grandfather, court nobles raised an agenda saying 'Although Yoshinobu TOKUGAWA returned the administration to the Imperial court, we doubt his genuine royalty. We should reprimand him to show his royalty by actual performance (which indicates Jikan nochi [an order for surrendering the Shogunate post and domains to the Imperial court]).'

After the meeting was called to order by Tadayasu NAKAYAMA, Emperor Meiji's maternal grandfather, court nobles raised an agenda saying 'Although Yoshinobu TOKUGAWA returned the administration to the Imperial court, we doubt his genuine royalty. We should reprimand him to show his royalty by actual performance (which indicates Jikan nochi [an order for surrendering the Shogunate post and domains to the Imperial court]).'

After the meeting was called to order by Tadayasu NAKAYAMA, Emperor Meiji's maternal grandfather, court nobles raised an agenda saying 'Although Yoshinobu TOKUGAWA returned the administration to the Imperial court, we doubt his genuine royalty. We should reprimand him to show his royalty by actual performance (which indicates Jikan nochi [an order for surrendering the Shogunate post and domains to the Imperial court]).'

sen.j: しかし山内容堂はそれを遮り、「この会議に、今までの功績がある徳川慶喜を出席させず、意見を述べる機会を与えないのは陰険である。数人の公家が幼い天皇を擁して権力を盗もうとしているだけだ」と論陣を張った。
sen.e: But Yodo YAMAUCHI intervened and argued, 'This conference is insidious, not allowing Yoshinobu to participate nor giving him to say, for all the contributions he made until now. This is just about a few court nobles trying to steel the authority with an amateur Emperor as their leader.'

But Yodo YAMAUCHI intervened and argued, 'This conference is insidious, not allowing Yoshinobu to participate nor giving him to say, for all the contributions he made until now. This is just a few court nobles' trial to steel the authority backing up an amateur Emperor as their leader.'
sen.cmt: This is just about a few court nobles trying to steel the authority with an amateur Emperor as their leader.→This is just a few court nobles' trial to steel the authority backing up an amateur Emperor as their leader.
sen.e: But Yodo YAMAUCHI intervened and argued, 'This conference is insidious, not allowing Yoshinobu to participate nor giving him to say, for all the contributions he made until now. This is just a few court nobles' trial to steel the authority backing up an amateur Emperor as their leader.'

sen.j: それに対し、岩倉が「帝は不世出の英主であり、今日のことはすべて天皇のご決断である。それを幼い天皇とは妄言である」と論駁したため、容堂が失言を謝罪した。
sen.e: Which Iwakura refuted saying 'The Emperor is a rare and distinguished monarch and today's incident is all what he approved. It is absurd to call him amateur,' so Yodo apologized his inappropriate comment.

Iwakura refuted this, saying 'The Emperor is a rare and distinguished monarch and today's incident is all what he approved. It is absurd to call him amateur,' so Yodo apologized his inappropriate comment.
sen.cmt: Which Iwakura refuted saying→Iwakura refuted this, saying
sen.e: Iwakura refuted this, saying 'The Emperor is a rare and distinguished monarch and today's incident is all what he approved. It is absurd to call him amateur,' so Yodo apologized his inappropriate comment.

sen.j: ただし、この容堂と岩倉のやり取りは後に作られた「挿話」であるという説もある。
sen.e: But there is a theory that this conversation between Yodo and Iwakura is an episode created afterward.
But there is a theory that this conversation between Yodo and Iwakura is an 'episode' created afterward.
sen.cmt: 引用符を追加しました
sen.e: But there is a theory that this conversation between Yodo and Iwakura is an 'episode' created afterward.

sen.j: 松平春嶽が容堂に助け船を出し、慶喜の出席を重ねて求めたが、岩倉や大久保利通は徳川家の罪状を並べてこれを断然拒否する。
sen.e: Shungaku MATSUDAIRA helped Yodo ask again for the attendance of Yoshinobu but Iwakura and Okubo strictly rejected by listing all sorts of Tokugawa Family's guilt.
Shungaku MATSUDAIRA rescued Yodo from asking again for the attendance of Yoshinobu but Iwakura and Okubo strictly rejected by listing all sorts of Tokugawa Family's guilt.
sen.cmt: Shungaku MATSUDAIRA helped Yodo ask again→Shungaku MATSUDAIRA rescued Yodo from asking again
sen.e: Shungaku MATSUDAIRA rescued Yodo from asking again for the attendance of Yoshinobu but Iwakura and Okubo strictly rejected by listing all sorts of Tokugawa Family's guilt.

sen.j: 大久保は慶喜が辞官納地に応ずることが前提であり、それがない時は免官削地を行いその罪を天下にさらすべきと主張したが、後藤象二郎は公明正大な措置が肝心でこの会議は陰険であると容堂の論を支持。
sen.e: Okuma insisted that Yoshinobu's attendance would be possible only on the premise that he would accept Jikan nochi, and if not, his sin must be brought to light and, but Shojiro GOTO sided with Yodo saying that it was important to act fair thus the Conference was insidious.

Okubo insisted that Yoshinobu's attendance would be possible only on the premise that he would accept Jikan nochi, and if not, his sin must be brought to light, but Shojiro GOTO sided with Yodo saying that it was important to act fair thus the Conference was insidious.
sen.cmt: ・Okuma→Okubo・butの前のandを削除しました
sen.e: Okubo insisted that Yoshinobu's attendance would be possible only on the premise that he would accept Jikan nochi, and if not, his sin must be brought to light, but Shojiro GOTO sided with Yodo saying that it was important to act fair thus the Conference was insidious.

sen.j: 大久保・後藤の間で激論が交わされる。
sen.e: Okubo and Goto had a heated debate.
Okubo and Goto had a heated debate.
Okubo and Goto had a heated debate.

sen.j: しかし、徳川慶勝・松平春嶽が容堂を支援。
sen.e: But Yoshikatsu TOKUGAWA and Shungaku MATSUDAIRA supported Yodo.
But Yoshikatsu TOKUGAWA and Shungaku MATSUDAIRA supported Yodo.
But Yoshikatsu TOKUGAWA and Shungaku MATSUDAIRA supported Yodo.

sen.j: 岩倉・大久保案は島津茂久が賛同したのみで、会議の趨勢は慶喜許容論に傾きつつあった。
sen.e: It was only Mochihisa SHIMAZU who assented to Iwakura and Okubo, and the course of the conference was leaning toward permitting the presence of Yoshinobu.
It was only Mochihisa SHIMAZU who assented to Iwakura and Okubo, and the course of the conference was leaning toward permitting the presence of Yoshinobu.
It was only Mochihisa SHIMAZU who assented to Iwakura and Okubo, and the course of the conference was leaning toward permitting the presence of Yoshinobu.

sen.j: 中山忠能が場を納めようと正親町三条実愛らと協議しようとしたところ、岩倉が「天皇の御前会議で私語するとは何事か」と叱り、一時休憩となった。
sen.e: When Tadayasu NAKAYAMA was about to consult Sanenaru Ogimachi-SANJO and others to settle the situation, Iwakura reproached, 'What are you thinking about to talk in whispers at the conference in the presence of the Emperor' and adjourned the meeting.

When Tadayasu NAKAYAMA was about to consult Sanenaru Ogimachi-SANJO and others to settle the situation, Iwakura reproached, 'What are you thinking about to talk in whispers at the conference in the presence of the Emperor' and adjourned the meeting.

When Tadayasu NAKAYAMA was about to consult Sanenaru Ogimachi-SANJO and others to settle the situation, Iwakura reproached, 'What are you thinking about to talk in whispers at the conference in the presence of the Emperor' and adjourned the meeting.

sen.j: 休憩中、岩倉は浅野茂勲に対し、この会議での妥協はあり得ず、いざというときは非常手段を取らざるを得ないとの覚悟の程を語り、茂勲の賛同を得る。
sen.e: During the break, Iwakura told Nagakoto ASANO that he was prepared to take an extreme action at the last moment because he did not expect the conference to arrive at a compromise, which Nagakuni approved.

During the break, Iwakura told Nagakoto ASANO that he was prepared to take an extreme action at the last moment because he did not expect the conference to arrive at a compromise, which Nagakuni approved.

During the break, Iwakura told Nagakoto ASANO that he was prepared to take an extreme action at the last moment because he did not expect the conference to arrive at a compromise, which Nagakuni approved.

sen.j: その知らせを辻将曹が後藤に伝え、妥協を促した。
sen.e: Tsuji Shoso conveyed this news to Goto and advised him to compromise.
Shoso TSUJI conveyed this news to Goto and advised him to compromise.
Shoso TSUJI conveyed this news to Goto and advised him to compromise.

sen.j: 後藤もここに至っては無駄な抵抗となることを悟り、山内容堂を説得。
sen.e: Goto who understood that any more protest would end up in vain also persuaded Yodo YAMAUCHI to compromise.
Goto who understood that any more protest would end up in vain also persuaded Yodo YAMAUCHI to compromise.
Goto who understood that any more protest would end up in vain also persuaded Yodo YAMAUCHI to compromise.

sen.j: 結局、春嶽・容堂ともに決議に従うこととなった。
sen.e: Shungaku and Yodo gave in to the resolution at last.
Shungaku and Yodo gave in to the resolution at last.
Shungaku and Yodo gave in to the resolution at last.

sen.j: こうして夜半まで続いた小御所会議は決着し、松平春嶽・徳川慶勝が慶喜へ辞官納地の決定を伝え、慶喜が自発的にこれを申し入れるという形式をとることが決定された。
sen.e: This is how Kogosho Conference finally came to conclusion in the middle of the night, which decided that Shungaku MATSUDAIRA and Yoshikatsu TOKUGAWA would deliver Yoshinobu the decision to impose Jikan nochi on him and that Yoshinobu was expected to voluntarily propose to do so for form's sake.

This is how Kogosho Conference finally came to conclusion in the middle of the night, which decided that Shungaku MATSUDAIRA and Yoshikatsu TOKUGAWA would deliver Yoshinobu the decision to impose Jikan nochi on him and that Yoshinobu was expected to voluntarily propose to do so for form's sake.

This is how Kogosho Conference finally came to conclusion in the middle of the night, which decided that Shungaku MATSUDAIRA and Yoshikatsu TOKUGAWA would deliver Yoshinobu the decision to impose Jikan nochi on him and that Yoshinobu was expected to voluntarily propose to do so for form's sake.

sen.j: 新政権の三職を集めて行われた初めての会議であったが、上記のごとく岩倉・大久保・後藤を除けば小御所会議での実際の発言はすべて議定からなされており、実質的には諸侯会議の色彩が強かった。
sen.e: Despite it was the first meeting held between the three top posts of the new administration, all the statements were exclusively made by legislatures during Kogosho Conference except for Iwakura, Okubo and Goto as above-mentioned, it was substantially very much like a loads conference.

Despite it was the first meeting held between the three offices of the new administration, all the statements were exclusively made by legislatures during Kogosho Conference except for Iwakura, Okubo and Goto as above-mentioned, thus it was substantially very much like a lords conference.
sen.cmt: ・three top posts→three offices・最後の文の直前にthusを追加しました・loads→lords
sen.e: Despite it was the first meeting held between the three offices of the new administration, all the statements were exclusively made by legislatures during Kogosho Conference except for Iwakura, Okubo and Goto as above-mentioned, thus it was substantially very much like a lords conference.

tit.e: Influence on the Succeeding Political Situation
Influence on the Succeeding Political Situation
Influence on the Succeeding Political Situation

sen.j: 小御所会議で徳川慶喜の辞官納地が一応決定されたため、一般的には王政復古クーデターは、薩摩・長州など倒幕派の勝利と受け取られることが多い。
sen.e: It is generally thought that tobakuha, led by Satsuma and Choshu, achieved a victory in the coup of Restoration of Imperial Rule because the Kogosho Conference decided to command Jikan nochi to Yoshinobu TOKUGAWA.

It is generally thought that tobakuha, led by Satsuma and Choshu, achieved a victory in the coup of Restoration of Imperial Rule because the Kogosho Conference decided to command Jikan nochi to Yoshinobu TOKUGAWA.

It is generally thought that tobakuha, led by Satsuma and Choshu, achieved a victory in the coup of Restoration of Imperial Rule because the Kogosho Conference decided to command Jikan nochi to Yoshinobu TOKUGAWA.

sen.j: しかし慶喜はもちろんのこと越前・土佐・尾張などの親幕派の執拗な抵抗により、辞官納地案は次第に骨抜きとされ、それほど倒幕派の思惑通り事態が進んだわけではない。
sen.e: But the draft Jikan nochi was eventually watered down by the persistent resistance of pro-shogunate group, such as Echizen, Tosa and Owari, not to mention Yoshinobu himself, and things did not go as tobakuha planned.

But the resolution of Jikan nochi was eventually watered down by the persistent resistance of pro-shogunate group, such as Echizen, Tosa and Owari, not to mention Yoshinobu himself, and things did not go as tobakuha planned.
sen.cmt: 「案」は「草案」より「決議案」の意味に近いと判断し、draft→resolution ofと変更しました
sen.e: But the resolution of Jikan nochi was eventually watered down by the persistent resistance of pro-shogunate group, such as Echizen, Tosa and Owari, not to mention Yoshinobu himself, and things did not go as tobakuha planned.

sen.j: 結局倒幕派が完全に主導権を握るのは翌年初めの鳥羽・伏見の戦いまで待たねばならなかった。
sen.e: It was not until after the Battle of Toba-Fushimi early next year that tobakuha finally grasped the complete initiative.
It was not until after the Battle of Toba-Fushimi early next year that tobakuha finally grasped the complete initiative.
It was not until after the Battle of Toba-Fushimi early next year that tobakuha finally grasped the complete initiative.

tit.j: 諸侯会議派の巻き返し
tit.e: The Comeback of Loads Conference Group
The Comeback of Lords Conference Group

sen.j: 小御所会議での辞官納地の決定は翌10日、松平春嶽・徳川慶勝によって徳川慶喜に伝えられたが、慶喜はただちに実行すれば部下が激昂するとの理由で猶予を求めた。
sen.e: The Kogosho Conference's decision to impose Jikan nochi was conveyed to Yoshinobu TOKUGAWA by Shungaku MATSUDAIRA and Yoshikatsu TOKUGAWA the next day, but Yochinobu asked to grant him a respite for the reason that an immediate execution of Jikan nochi would infuriate his vassals.

sen.j: 同日赦免された長州藩兵が入京したこともあり、大久保は強気に出るが、京都には会津藩・桑名藩などの徳川方諸藩の兵も駐在しており、戦闘回避を求める声も強かった。
sen.e: Although Okubo was acting in a strong attitude, gaining momentum by the return of samurai of the Choshu clan to Kyoto just discharged on the same day, there existed a strong call to avoid war from soldiers of Aizu Domain, Kuwana Domain and other domains on Tokugawa side, residing in Kyoto.

Although Okubo was acting in a strong attitude, gaining momentum by the return of samurai of the Choshu clan to Kyoto just discharged on the same day, there existed a strong call to avoid war from soldiers of Aizu Domain, Kuwana Domain and other domains on Tokugawa side, residing in Kyoto.

sen.j: ここから春嶽・慶勝・容堂ら反倒幕派が巻き返しを図る。
sen.e: From here, Shungaku, Yoshikatsu and Yodo, the anti-tobakuha group, began to regain lost ground.
From here, Shungaku, Yoshikatsu and Yodo, the anti-tobakuha group, began to regain lost ground.
From here, Shungaku, Yoshikatsu and Yodo, the anti-tobakuha group, began to regain lost ground.

sen.j: 山内容堂は12日、辞官納地問題を松平春嶽の周旋に委任することを求める建白書を新政権に提出。
sen.e: Yodo YAMAUCHI submitted a petition to the new administration on 12, to suggest to leave the Jikan Nochi issue to the procurement of Shungaku MATSUDAIRA.
Yodo YAMAUCHI submitted a petition to the new administration on 12, to suggest to delegate the Jikan Nochi issue to the mediation of Shungaku MATSUDAIRA.

sen.e: Yodo YAMAUCHI submitted a petition to the new administration on 12, to suggest to delegate the Jikan Nochi issue to the mediation of Shungaku MATSUDAIRA.

sen.j: 14日には仁和寺宮（議定）が岩倉や大久保ら身分が低い者を抑えるべく身分を正すことを求める意見書を提出した。
sen.e: On 14, Ninnajinomiya (legislature) handed in a written opinion which suggested to raise the status-consciousness in order to control the people of low rank, including Iwakura and Okubo.
On 14, Ninnajinomiya (legislature) handed in a written opinion which suggested to raise the status-consciousness in order to control the people of low rank, including Iwakura and Okubo.
On 14, Ninnajinomiya (legislature) handed in a written opinion which suggested to raise the status-consciousness in order to control the people of low rank, including Iwakura and Okubo.

sen.j: これらの情勢から岩倉までもが弱気となり、同日松平春嶽が辞官納地の具体的内容を岩倉に迫った際も、岩倉は慶喜が「前内大臣」と名乗ればよいとし、領地については確答を避けるなど弱腰になってしまう。
sen.e: Even Iwakura developed a bearish attitude under such situation and took soft stand toward Shungaku MATSUDAIRA when he urged Iwakura to give specific details of Jikan nochi on that day, by answering that it would be enough for Yoshinobu to call himself 'former Minister of the Center' and by avoiding to give clear answer for the land issue.

Even Iwakura developed a hesitant attitude under such situation and took soft stand toward Shungaku MATSUDAIRA when he urged Iwakura to give specific details of Jikan nochi on that day, by answering that it would be enough for Yoshinobu to call himself 'former Minister of the Center' and avoiding to give clear answer for the land issue.

Even Iwakura developed a hesitant attitude under such situation and took soft stand toward Shungaku MATSUDAIRA when he urged Iwakura to give specific details of Jikan nochi on that day, by answering that it would be enough for Yoshinobu to call himself 'former Minister of the Center' and avoiding to give clear answer for the land issue.

sen.j: 岩倉は慶喜が辞官納地に応じさえすれば慶喜を議定に任じるという協調策を大久保・西郷らに提示した。
sen.e: Iwakura proposed a collaboration policy to Okubo and Saigo, which would allow to appoint Yoshinobu to legislature only if he accepts Jikan nochi.
Iwakura proposed a collaboration policy to Okubo and Saigo, which would allow to appoint Yoshinobu to legislature only if he accepts Jikan nochi.
Iwakura proposed a collaboration policy to Okubo and Saigo, which would allow to appoint Yoshinobu to legislature only if he accepts Jikan nochi.

sen.j: いっぽう、13日に大阪城に戻っていた慶喜は、16日にはイギリス・フランス第二帝政・オランダ王国・アメリカ合衆国・イタリア王国・プロイセン王国6国の公使を引見し、王政復古後も外交権が自らにあることをアピールするなど、強気の姿勢を崩していなかった。
sen.e: Meanwhile, after returning to Osaka Castle on 13, Yoshinobu had audiences with ministers of Britain, Second French Empire, the Netherlands, the United States of America, Italy, and Prussia to appeal that he still held the diplomatic right even after the Restoration of Imperial Rule, showing no sign of softening his stance.

Meanwhile, after returning to Osaka Castle on 13, Yoshinobu had audiences with ministers of six countries; Britain, Second French Empire, the Netherlands, the United States of America, Italy, and Prussia to appeal that he still held the diplomatic right even after the Restoration of Imperial Rule, showing no sign of softening his stance.
sen.cmt: of six countries;を補完しました
sen.e: Meanwhile, after returning to Osaka Castle on 13, Yoshinobu had audiences with ministers of six countries; Britain, Second French Empire, the Netherlands, the United States of America, Italy, and Prussia to appeal that he still held the diplomatic right even after the Restoration of Imperial Rule, showing no sign of softening his stance.

sen.j: 大目付永井尚志も薩長二賊を討つべしと主張。
sen.e: Naoyuki NAGAI, Ometsuke (chief inspector of the Edo shogunate) too insisted to attack the two rebels, Saccho (Satsuma and Choshu).
Naoyuki NAGAI, Ometsuke (chief inspector of the Edo shogunate) also insisted to attack the two rebels, Saccho (Satsuma and Choshu).
Naoyuki NAGAI, Ometsuke (chief inspector of the Edo shogunate) also insisted to attack the two rebels, Saccho (Satsuma and Choshu).

sen.j: 慶喜は大目付戸川安愛に薩長の非をならす上表文を持たせて上京させるとともに、在京の譜代大名諸藩軍へ上坂を命じた。
sen.e: Yoshinobu ordered Yasuchika TOGAWA, Ometsuke, to come up to Kyoto with Johyobun (memorial to the Emperor) to denounce Saccho and also ordered the armies of fudai daimyo (a daimyo in hereditary vassal to the Tokugawa family), staying in Kyoto, to come up to Osaka.

Yoshinobu ordered Yasuchika TOGAWA, Ometsuke, to come up to Kyoto with Johyobun (memorial to the Emperor) to denounce Saccho and also ordered the armies of fudai daimyo (a daimyo in hereditary vassal to the Tokugawa family), staying in Kyoto, to come up to Osaka.

Yoshinobu ordered Yasuchika TOGAWA, Ometsuke, to come up to Kyoto with Johyobun (memorial to the Emperor) to denounce Saccho and also ordered the armies of fudai daimyo (a daimyo in hereditary vassal to the Tokugawa family), staying in Kyoto, to come up to Osaka.

sen.j: 一方、新政府側でも19日大久保と寺島宗則が、新政権の諸外国への承認獲得と外交の継続宣言をすべく、アーネスト・サトウ（英国公使館付通訳）やシャルル・ド・モンブラン（フランス貴族）と協議し、新政権から諸外国への通達詔書を作成する。
sen.e: The new administration, in the meantime, issued an imperial edict to foreign countries which was written by Okubo and Munenori TERASHIMA upon consultation with Ernest Mason Satow (interpreter of the British legation) and Charles de Montblanc (French nobleman) in order to win recognition for the new administration from foreign countries and to declare the continuation of diplomacy.

The new administration, in the meantime, issued an imperial edict to foreign countries which was written by Okubo and Munenori TERASHIMA upon consultation with Ernest Mason Satow (interpreter of the British legation) and Charles de Montblanc (French nobleman) in order to win recognition for the new administration from foreign countries and to declare the continuation of diplomacy.

The new administration, in the meantime, issued an imperial edict to foreign countries which was written by Okubo and Munenori TERASHIMA upon consultation with Ernest Mason Satow (interpreter of the British legation) and Charles de Montblanc (French nobleman) in order to win recognition for the new administration from foreign countries and to declare the continuation of diplomacy.

sen.j: しかし松平春嶽・山内容堂らは、その文面に「列藩会議を興して国事を議する」とあることを逆手に取り、小御所会議は所詮数藩の代表のみであり列藩会議とは言えないとして、改めて議論を行うべきと主張し、諸侯会議派がますます勢いを得た。
sen.e: But Shungaku MATSUDAIRA and Yodo YAMAUCHI used the phrase in the edict 'the affairs of State shall be discussed at Reppan Conference (conference of many feudal clans)' as an underhanded way and insisted to hold discussion once again because Kogosho Conference was represented by too few domains to call it Reppan (many feudal clans), which further encouraged the loads conference group.

But Shungaku MATSUDAIRA and Yodo YAMAUCHI used the phrase in the edict 'the affairs of State shall be discussed at Reppan Conference (conference of many feudal clans)' as an underhanded way and insisted to hold discussion once again because Kogosho Conference was represented by too few domains to call it Reppan (many feudal clans), which further encouraged the lords conference group.

But Shungaku MATSUDAIRA and Yodo YAMAUCHI used the phrase in the edict 'the affairs of State shall be discussed at Reppan Conference (conference of many feudal clans)' as an underhanded way and insisted to hold discussion once again because Kogosho Conference was represented by too few domains to call it Reppan (many feudal clans), which further encouraged the lords conference group.

sen.j: こうして22日には土佐藩邸に松平春嶽と永井尚志が集って原案を作成し、23日・24日に再び三職会議が召集される（岩倉は欠席）。
sen.e: Consequently, Shungaku MATSUDAIRA and Naoyuki NAGAI gathered at the residence of Tosa Domain on 22 to write a draft resolution and Sanshoku meeting (meeting of the three top posts) were again convented on 23 and 24 (Iwakura was absent).

Consequently, Shungaku MATSUDAIRA and Naoyuki NAGAI gathered at the residence of Tosa Domain on 22 to write a draft resolution and Sanshoku meeting (meeting of the three offices) were again convoked on 23 and 24 (Iwakura was absent).

Consequently, Shungaku MATSUDAIRA and Naoyuki NAGAI gathered at the residence of Tosa Domain on 22 to write a draft resolution and Sanshoku meeting (meeting of the three offices) were again convoked on 23 and 24 (Iwakura was absent).

sen.j: ここにおいて、徳川家の納地は「政府之御用途」のため供するという表現となり、慶喜に対する処分的な色彩は全く失われた。
sen.e: The resolution went as soft as saying that the Tokugawa land shall be returned to the Imperial court as 'for the government use', completely losing the aspect of giving a reprimand to Yoshinobu.
The resolution went as soft as saying that the Tokugawa land shall be returned to the Imperial court as 'for the government use', completely losing the aspect of giving a reprimand to Yoshinobu.
The resolution went as soft as saying that the Tokugawa land shall be returned to the Imperial court as 'for the government use', completely losing the aspect of giving a reprimand to Yoshinobu.

sen.j: さらに実際の納地高も「天下公論の上」すなわち諸侯会議における議論を経て決定するとされた。
sen.e: Also, it stated that the land area to be returned would be decided 'referring to public opinion', that is to say, through discussion at loads conference.
Also, it stated that the land area to be returned would be decided 'referring to public opinion', that is to say, through discussion at lords conference.
Also, it stated that the land area to be returned would be decided 'referring to public opinion', that is to say, through discussion at lords conference.

sen.j: この結果は春嶽・慶勝によって慶喜にもたらされ、慶喜も承諾。
sen.e: Shungaku and Yoshikatsu delivered this decision to Yoshinobu who accepted it.
Shungaku and Yoshikatsu delivered this decision to Yoshinobu who accepted it.
Shungaku and Yoshikatsu delivered this decision to Yoshinobu who accepted it.

sen.j: ここに小御所会議の結果は無意味化し、辞官納地問題は骨抜きとなり、かえって慶喜を含む諸侯会議派が勢いを得る結果となったのである。
sen.e: Here, the conclusion of Kogosho Conference was effectively nullified and Jikan nochi issue was watered down, which led, in contrast, the lords conference group, including Yoshinobu, to gain momentum.

tit.j: 薩摩藩の挑発と幕臣の暴発
tit.e: The Provocation by Satsuma Domain and Outbreak of Shogun's Retainer
The Provocation by Satsuma Domain and Outbreak of Shogun's Retainer
The Provocation by Satsuma Domain and Outbreak of Shogun's Retainer

sen.j: こうした状況を焦慮した西郷は、幕府側を挑発するという非常手段（作略）に出る。
sen.e: Worried about such circumstance, Saigo took an emergency measure (strategy); provocation.
Worried about such circumstance, Saigo took an emergency measure (strategy), in other words, provoking the shogunate side.
Worried about such circumstance, Saigo took an emergency measure (strategy), in other words, provoking the shogunate side.

sen.j: 江戸の益満休之助・伊牟田尚平に命じ、相楽総三ら浪士を集めて江戸市中に放火・掠奪・暴行などを行わせる攪乱工作を開始。
sen.e: He ordered Kyunosuke MASUMITSU and Shohei IMUTA in Edo to rally Sozo SAGARA and other roshi (masterless samurai) to carry out arson, looting and violence to throw Edo city into confusion.
He ordered Kyunosuke MASUMITSU and Shohei IMUTA in Edo to rally Sozo SAGARA and other roshi (masterless samurai) to carry out arson, looting and violence to throw Edo city into confusion.
He ordered Kyunosuke MASUMITSU and Shohei IMUTA in Edo to rally Sozo SAGARA and other roshi (masterless samurai) to carry out arson, looting and violence to throw Edo city into confusion.

sen.j: 江戸警備の任にあった庄内藩がこれに怒り、12月25日勘定奉行小栗忠順ら幕閣の了承の下、薩摩藩および佐土原藩（薩摩支藩）邸を焼き討ちするという事件が発生した。
sen.e: Shonai Domain, which was responsible for protecting the safety of Edo city, took offense at this incident and put the residences of Satsuma Domain and Sadowara Domain (Satsuma Domain's branch domain) on fire on December 25, with the consent of Tadamasa OGURI, kanjo bugyo (commissioner of finance) and cabinet officials of the Shogunate.

Shonai Domain, which was responsible for the security of Edo, took offense at this incident and put the residences of Satsuma Domain and Sadowara Domain (Satsuma Domain's branch domain) on fire on January 19, 1868, with the consent of cabinet officials of the Shogunate including Tadamasa OGURI who was kanjo bugyo (commissioner of finance).
sen.cmt: ・for protecting the safety of→for the security ofEdo city→Edo・日時を西暦に変換しました・with the consent of Tadamasa OGURI, kanjo bugyo （commissioner of finance) and cabinet officials of the Shogunate→with the consent of cabinet officials of the Shogunate including Tadamasa OGURI who was kanjo bugyo (commissioner of finance)
sen.e: Shonai Domain, which was responsible for the security of Edo, took offense at this incident and put the residences of Satsuma Domain and Sadowara Domain (Satsuma Domain's branch domain) on fire on January 19, 1868, with the consent of cabinet officials of the Shogunate including Tadamasa OGURI who was kanjo bugyo (commissioner of finance).

sen.j: 大目付滝川具挙・勘定奉行並小野友五郎らによって、江戸の薩摩藩邸焼き討ちの報が12月28日大坂城にもたらされると、城内の強硬派が激昂。
sen.e: Once the news of arson was delivered to Osaka Castle on December 18 by Tomoaki TAKIGAWA, Ometsuke, and Tomogoro ONO, corresponding post of kanjo bugyo, the hard-liners in the castle was infuriated.

Once the news of arson of Satsuma domain residence in Edo was delivered to Osaka Castle on January 22, 1868 by Tomoaki TAKIGAWA, Ometsuke, and Tomogoro ONO, kanjo bugyo-nami (assistant commissioner of finance), the hard-liners in the castle was infuriated.
sen.cmt: ・西暦に変換しました・「江戸の薩摩藩邸」を訳出しました・「勘定奉行並（なみ）」とは勘定奉行補佐の役職のようですhttp://www.ryoma-kinenkan.jp/study/life/3.phphttp://www.hakodate150.com/modules/d3blog3/details.php?bid=129
sen.e: Once the news of arson of Satsuma domain residence in Edo was delivered to Osaka Castle on January 22, 1868 by Tomoaki TAKIGAWA, Ometsuke, and Tomogoro ONO, kanjo bugyo-nami (assistant commissioner of finance), the hard-liners in the castle was infuriated.

sen.j: 薩摩討つべしとの主戦論が沸騰し、「討薩表」を携えた滝川が翌慶応4年（1868年）正月3日鳥羽で薩摩藩兵と衝突し、戦闘となった（詳細は鳥羽・伏見の戦いを参照）。
sen.e: Pro-war argument heated up calling for attacking Satsuma, and Takigawa, who carried with him the statement to the Emperor to avenge Satsuma, encountered samurai of the Satsuma clan next year, on January 3, Keio 4 and a war broke out.

Pro-war argument heated up calling for attacking Satsuma, and Takigawa, who carried with him the statement to the Emperor to avenge Satsuma, encountered samurai of the Satsuma clan at Toba in January 27, 1868 and a war broke out (for more detail, refer to the Battle of Toba-Fushimi).
sen.cmt: ・西暦に変換しました・(for more detail, refer to the Battle of Toba-Fushimi)を補完しました
sen.e: Pro-war argument heated up calling for attacking Satsuma, and Takigawa, who carried with him the statement to the Emperor to avenge Satsuma, encountered samurai of the Satsuma clan at Toba in January 27, 1868 and a war broke out (for more detail, refer to the Battle of Toba-Fushimi).

sen.j: 戦いは徳川方の敗北となり、慶喜は大坂城を脱出して江戸へ退却。
sen.e: The war ended in defeat of Tokugawa side and Yoshinobu escaped from Osaka Castle and retreated to Edo.
The war ended in defeat of Tokugawa side and Yoshinobu escaped from Osaka Castle and retreated to Edo.
The war ended in defeat of Tokugawa side and Yoshinobu escaped from Osaka Castle and retreated to Edo.

sen.j: ここに慶喜は正式に朝敵となり、追討令が出されるに至った。
sen.e: Now, Yoshinobu formally became Emperor's enemy and an order to track down and kill him was issued.
Now, Yoshinobu formally became Emperor's enemy and an order to track down and kill him was issued.
Now, Yoshinobu formally became Emperor's enemy and an order to track down and kill him was issued.

sen.j: 慶喜寄りの諸侯会議派もまたこの戦いの結果、倒幕派への転換を余儀なくされたのである。
sen.e: As a result of this war, the loads conference group, which sided with Yoshinobu, was also forced to turn to tobakuha.
As a result of this war, the lords conference group, which sided with Yoshinobu, was also forced to turn to tobakuha.
As a result of this war, the lords conference group, which sided with Yoshinobu, was also forced to turn to tobakuha.

tit.e: Retreat of Loads Conference Argument
Decline of Lords Conference Argument
Decline of Lords Conference Argument

sen.j: 鳥羽・伏見の戦いに勝利した新政府は、徳川家追討とともに新たな行政制度を整える必要から三職の下に七科を設置、のちに三職八局制となる（詳細は近代日本の官制明治時代初期を参照）。
sen.e: After the victory in the Battle of Toba and Fushimi, the new government set up seven divisions under the three top posts, which were later organized into the three-posts and eight-bureau system (refer to Modern Japanese Government System in Early Meiji Period for details) besides tracking down and killing Tokugawa Family.
sen.cmt: 七科の定訳不明現在の省庁の課に当たるものとして、divisionとしました。「三職八局制」定訳不明「近代日本の官制明治時代初期」定訳不明
sen.e: After the victory in the Battle of Toba and Fushimi, the new government set up seven departments under the three offices, which were later organized into the Three Offices Eight Bureaus system besides tracking down and killing Tokugawa Family (for more details, refer to Government Organization in Modern Japan, Early Meiji Period).
sen.cmt: 「七科」「三職八局」「官制」：調査のうえ用語共有に登録→英訳を修正しました
sen.e: After the victory in the Battle of Toba and Fushimi, the new government set up seven departments under the three offices, which were later organized into the Three Offices Eight Bureaus system besides tracking down and killing Tokugawa Family (for more details, refer to Government Organization in Modern Japan, Early Meiji Period).

sen.j: この間、名目的に要職に任じられた公家・諸侯らが実務に疎かったことから、各藩から召集された徴士が実務を握り、維新官僚として成長し、次第に行政の主導権を握るようになる。
sen.e: In the meantime, instead of court nobles and lords who nominally held an important post but actually were out of touch with practical works, feudal retainers who were convened to the government from domains gripped the practical work, grew as Restoration bureaucrats, and gradually won administrative initiative.

In the meantime, instead of court nobles and lords who nominally held important posts but actually were out of touch with practical works, officials who were convened to the government from each domain gripped the practical work, grew as Restoration bureaucrats, and gradually won administrative initiative.
sen.cmt: ・an important post→important posts・ feudal retainers who were convened to the government from domains→officials who were convened to the government from each domain（「徴士」は定訳に、「各」を訳出しました）
sen.e: In the meantime, instead of court nobles and lords who nominally held important posts but actually were out of touch with practical works, officials who were convened to the government from each domain gripped the practical work, grew as Restoration bureaucrats, and gradually won administrative initiative.

sen.j: 1月より持ち越しの由利公正（越前藩士）が起草した新政府の方針案では、諸侯会議派である土佐藩の福岡孝弟が第一条冒頭に「列侯会議ヲ興シ」の字句を挿入し、表題も「会盟」と改めており、3月の木戸による国是建議の後提出したが、もはやこの時期には列侯会議は必要性を失していた。
sen.e: After the draft policy of the new government was prepared by Kosei YURI (feudal retainer of Echizen) in January, Takachika FUKUOKA of Tosa Domain who belonged to the loads conference group inserted the phrase 'Establish a council by feudal lords' to the beginning of the Article 1 and amended the title to 'Kaimei (pledge of feudal lords)', and it was submitted after Kido submitted the national policy proposal in March, but the necessity of the council by feudal lords had already been lost by then.

For the draft policy of the new government prepared by Kosei YURI (feudal retainer of Echizen) and had been carried over from January, Takachika FUKUOKA of Tosa Domain who belonged to the lords conference group inserted the phrase 'Establish a council by feudal lords' to the beginning of the Article 1 and amended the title to 'Kaimei (pledge of feudal lords)', and submitted it after Kido's proposal for national policy in March, but the necessity of the council by feudal lords had already been lost by then.
sen.cmt: ・After the draft policy of the new government was prepared by Kosei YURI (feudal retainer of Echizen) in January→For the draft policy of the new government prepared by Kosei YURI (feudal retainer of Echizen) and had been carried over from January・loads→lords・it was submitted after Kido submitted the national policy proposal→submitted it after Kido's proposal for national policy
sen.e: For the draft policy of the new government prepared by Kosei YURI (feudal retainer of Echizen) and had been carried over from January, Takachika FUKUOKA of Tosa Domain who belonged to the lords conference group inserted the phrase 'Establish a council by feudal lords' to the beginning of the Article 1 and amended the title to 'Kaimei (pledge of feudal lords)', and submitted it after Kido's proposal for national policy in March, but the necessity of the council by feudal lords had already been lost by then.

sen.j: 福岡の草案は長州藩の木戸孝允や岩倉・三条実美らの手により「広ク会議ヲ興シ」と修正され、形式も諸藩の会盟から天皇以下諸臣が国是を誓うという形式となり、五箇条の御誓文として発せられた。
sen.e: Fukuoka's draft was corrected by Takayoshi KIDO of Choshu Domain, Iwakura and Sanetomi SANJO to say "Deliberate assemblies shall be widely established", and although it was originally meant to take the form of pledge of feudal lords of domains, it was changed into the declaration of national policies by the Emperor and his vassals, to be finally announced as the Charter Oath of Five Articles.

Fukuoka's draft was corrected by Takayoshi KIDO of Choshu Domain, Iwakura and Sanetomi SANJO to say "Deliberate assemblies shall be widely established", and its form was also changed from the pledge of feudal lords of domains into the declaration of national policies by the Emperor and his vassals, to be finally announced as the Charter Oath of Five Articles.
sen.cmt: 真ん中の文を改変しました
sen.e: Fukuoka's draft was corrected by Takayoshi KIDO of Choshu Domain, Iwakura and Sanetomi SANJO to say "Deliberate assemblies shall be widely established", and its form was also changed from the pledge of feudal lords of domains into the declaration of national policies by the Emperor and his vassals, to be finally announced as the Charter Oath of Five Articles.

sen.j: ここに雄藩諸侯会議路線は潰え、有司（維新官僚）専制による明治維新への道が開かれるのである。
sen.e: This is how the major domains' loads conference line died and the way to the Meiji restoration by Yushi Sensei (autocratic government dominated by domain clique [Restoration bureaucrats]) was opened.
This is how the major domains' lords conference line died and the way to the Meiji restoration by Yushi Sensei (autocratic government dominated by domain clique [Restoration bureaucrats]) was opened.
This is how the major domains' lords conference line died and the way to the Meiji restoration by Yushi Sensei (autocratic government dominated by domain clique [Restoration bureaucrats]) was opened.
